TCU Senate Presidential Campaign

I helped design the logo and consult on the marketing for Shannon Lee's winning 2019 presidential campaign for TCU Senate, with the help of an amazing team of peers.

Two versions of the final logo, with inverse color palettes (Click for full view)

  • time range: April 2019
  • client: Shannon Lee
  • tools: Adobe Illustrator, Photoshop
  • my role: branding designer, marketing consultant
  • team members: Ayden Crosby, Annika Han, Madeline Keipp, Shannon Lee, Kristen Moran, Sarah Park, Veronica Stewart-Frommer, Ciel Sripasert

This campaign involved a quick turnover of publicity materials that relied on a solid campaign slogan as well as distinct, cohesive branding. I was fortunate to join the team at the start and work with Shannon to develop the "Lead With Lee" slogan and imagery that would invoke her bold, empowering personality and platform.

Mockups I sent to the team to choose between

We began our process by looking at color and graphic references that Shannon wished for us to emulate—examples include Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez's 2019 congressional campaign and Andy Warhol's Cow prints. Much of my role involved sending back and forth tweaked versions of the logo design in a team group chat; we ran through dozens of font, color, and angle changes before it was perfect.

Final poster graphic (Click for full view)

In the end, I was not the one with the time to create the graphics that used the logo, although I was able to give suggestions on design for my teammates who finalized posters, buttons and stickers, and platform infographics in an impressively short amount of time. These graphics were used on Instagram, Facebook, and the campaign website, truly making an impact on the outcome of the race.
